intro: Alphandia verniciflua, commonly known as the lac tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant produces a resinous sap that is used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect and bird species.
